<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 12pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(11, 12, 12); background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Paragraph 200 of the National
Planning Policy Framework (revised December 2023) states that <i>“In
determining applications, local planning authorities should require an
applicant to describe the significance of any heritage assets affected,
including any contribution made by their setting. The level of detail should be
proportionate to the assets’ importance and no more than is sufficient to
understand the potential impact of the proposal on their significance”, </i><o:p></o:p></span></p><p>

</p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:12.0pt;line-height:107%;font-family:
&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">The application is not accompanied by a Heritage Statement and
therefore insufficient information has been submitted with the application in
regard to the heritage impacts that the proposal may have on this Grade II*
listed building as a result of the proposed installations. &nbsp;The Local Planning Authority is therefore
unable to fully assess the merits or otherwise of this proposal.&nbsp; Accordingly, the proposal is contrary to Section 16(2) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990,&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">the
provisions of the </span><span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: rgb(11, 12, 12);">National
Planning Policy Framework (revised December 2023), policy HC1 (Heritage
conservation and growth) of The London Plan (March 2021) and policy LP3 A. and C.
(Designated Heritage Assets – Listed Buildings) of the Hackney Local Plan 2033
(LP33) (adopted July 2020).&nbsp;</span></p>
description: The removal and replacement of 2 no. existing antennas with 2 no. upgraded antennas, the relocation of 1 no. existing antenna and 1 no. GPS module, the installation of 3 no. additional antennas and 2 no. 300mm diameter transmission dishes, and ancillary development thereto, including the installation of Ericsson Radio Systems (ERSs).
